explain: The Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announces their pregnancy in a creative way by setting their rap video to the theme song from the popular 90s sitcom "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air". In their video, which was viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube, they share their big moment, moving into their first home in Happy Valley, Oregon and starting their homestead.

The core idea of the given aspect is that Jesse and Melissa Meek created a funny parody video set to the theme song of "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air," announcing their pregnancy and their accomplishments so far, such as buying their first house and starting their homestead. This video was viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube, showcasing the couple's creative and entertaining approach to sharing their life updates.
The Meeks announced their pregnancy in a video, which allowed their loved ones who were far away to know about the baby, even though they were not present in person with them.
